intro: Oxyanthus bremekampii, commonly known as the Bremekamp's oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy, and it grows as a shrub or small tree. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
